intro: Sauvagesia duidae, commonly known as the Duidae sauvagesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
